page.title: 19The Grid Substation,Hutton
page.content: The grid substation in our area seemed a good place to visit.Nobody works there full time but it is visited regularly.It was built there so that it would power the railway. It is inspected once a month and each piece of equipment has a duplicate. Sometimes electricity cables get covered with ice and the poles fall down due to the weight.These poles which carry the cables are made from red fir grown in Scandiniava and they have to be creosoted for protection. Each tree will have grown for between 40 to 50 years.One of the poles had 10m 29cm 1985 printed about 2m above the ground.The first numbers say how long the pole is and the last the year it was made.Each pole goes 2m into the ground.The transformers made a humming sound,the bigger they are the deeper and louder the sound will be.
